The 'history of Iraq from 2003 to 2011' began with the U.S.-led invasion of the
country in March 2003 which overthrew the Ba'ath Party government of Saddam
Hussein. This was followed by a war that lasted from 2003 to 2011, and ended
when U.S. troops left the country. In April 2003, the Coalition Provisional
Authority, a transitional government, was established. It was replaced in June
2004 by a caretaker government â the Iraqi Interim Government. Following
parliamentary elections in January 2005, this administration was replaced in May
by the Iraqi Transitional Government. A year later, the Al Maliki I Government,
took office.
headings: Legal status of the coalition presence
